item.description:
(2009) Written and directed by Quentin Tarantino. Cast: Brad Pitt, Christoph Waltz, Eli Roth, Michael Fassbender, Diane Kruger, Mélanie Laurent, Rod Taylor.

Quentin Tarantino takes a bold move into a more serious subject and survives with his movie-mad, post-modern style intact. Brad Pitt stars as a backwoods lieutenant plunged into World War II who leads a squadron of Jewish soldiers into surprise attacks on Nazis in France. His story interlocks with a French Jewish woman (Mélanie Laurent) working at a cinema in Paris after witnessing the death of her family, a fearless Allied spy from Germany (Diane Kruger), and a Nazi self-titled "Jew-hunter" played with psychopathic sangfroid by Christoph Waltz (Winner Best Supporting Actor - Golden Globes). Of course, being a Tarantino film means Inglourious Basterds is also about movies, as the director brilliantly riffs on World War II flicks, spaghetti Westerns, and European classics. "Contains all the things his fans like about Tarantino - the wit, the audacity, the sudden violence - but this movie's emotional core and bigness of spirit are new." Mick LaSalle, San Francisco Chronicle.. Winner of Best performance By a Cast in a Motion Picture - Screen Actors Guild.

www.inglouriousbasterds-movie.com
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the lobby. The movie starts at 7:30 so let's meet by 7:15.
item.name: Inglorious Basterds
